citation.article-title: Actinocorallia gen. nov., a new genus of the order Actinomycetales.

p.s: Actinocorallia (Ac.ti.no.co.ral'li.a. Gr. n. actis, a ray; Gr. n. corallium, coral; Gr. n. Actinocorallia, referring to a microorganism that forms sporophores resembling coral)
Vegetative mycelia are branched but not fragmented.
Sporophores arise from substrate mycelia, and on the tips of the sporophores long chains of nonmotile spores are formed (Fig. 1b and c).
Type III cell wall composition (meso-2,6-diaminopimelic acid).
The whole-cell sugar pattern type is type C (no diagnostic sugars).
Type la fatty acid pattern (straight-chain saturated acids and monounsaturated acids).
The predominant menaquinones are MK-9(H4) and MK-9(H6).
Type PII phospholipid pattern (phosphatidylethanolamine, no phosphatidylcholine, no glucosamine-containing phospholipids).
The N-acyl type of the muramic acid is acetyl.
The type species is Actinocorallia herbida.
